head.title: A European Tour Is Set This Summer

hedline.hl1: A European Tour Is Set This Summer

block.p: Preparations for the Summer Olympics in Sydney, Australia, will take the United States women's national team to Europe for games in Germany and Norway.

The Americans, the defending world and Olympic champions, will play in a tournament in Germany in commemoration of the 100-year anniversary of the German Football Federation. The other nations in the tournament are Norway, China and Germany. The United States is scheduled to play Norway on July 16 in Osnabruck, China on July 19 in Gottingen and Germany July 22 in Braunschweig. All tournament games will be played as doubleheaders and the winner will determined on total points.
Preparations for the Summer Olympics in Sydney, Australia, will take the United States women's national team to Europe for games in Germany and Norway.

The Americans, the defending world and Olympic champions, will play in a tournament in Germany in commemoration of the 100-year anniversary of the German Football Federation. The other nations in the tournament are Norway, China and Germany. The United States is scheduled to play Norway on July 16 in Osnabruck, China on July 19 in Gottingen and Germany July 22 in Braunschweig. All tournament games will be played as doubleheaders and the winner will determined on total points.

After the games in Germany, the United States team will travel to Norway for two matches. The game on July 27 will be played in Tromso, which is 115 miles north of the Artic Circle, and is scheduled to begin at 10:30 p.m. local time. Lights, however, will not be needed because there are nearly 24 hours of daylight at that time of the year. The final match of the trip will be played on July 30 in Oslo.
